oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Uncle Dave Macon 100th Birthday Anniversary Party - Country Music Hall of Fame - 1970-10-07
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Recording of an anniversary party for Uncle Dave Macon's 100th birthday, from October 7, 1970, 11:00 AM, located at the Country Music Hall of Fame and Museum. Program includes Frank Jones (host/speaker), Minnie Pearl (speaker), Tennessee Ernie Ford (speaker), Roy Acuff (speaker), Mayor Beverly Briley (speaker), Fiddlin' Sid Harkreader (speaker/performer), Jo Walker (speaker), and Harold Hitt (speaker).
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Fiddlin' Sid Harkreader
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:00) [microphone check] -- (00:47) Opening statements (Frank Jones) -- (01:39) Frank Jones introduces Minnie Pearl -- (01:43) Minnie Pearl talks about meeting and knowing Uncle Dave Macon, and reads an excerpt from his biography -- (08:50) Jones thanks Minnie, and introduces Tennessee Ernie Ford -- (09:20) Ford talks about meeting and knowing Uncle Dave Macon through the Grand Ole Opry -- (10:18) Ford tells a story about Uncle Dave Macon not knowing who Bing Crosby is -- (11:00) Jones thanks Ford, and introduces Roy Acuff -- (11:20) Acuff talks about knowing and touring with Uncle Dave Macon for many years -- (12:15) Acuff talks about Macon's career successes -- (12:40) Acuff tells a story about Macon being smart with people he toured with -- (13:25) Acuff talks about being the one to first convince Macon to fly on a plane, and jokes about Macon's innocent drinking habits, and tells the story about getting him to fly -- (16:50) Acuff tells another story about taking a country ham from Nashville to Chicago, and also taking the box it shipped in back to Nashville -- (18:45) Acuff tells another funny story about Macon -- (19:40) Jones thanks Acuff, and introduces Nashville Mayor, Beverly Briley -- (20:19) Briley talks about Macon being some of the first music he ever listened to, and Macon being friends with his grandfathers -- (21:35) Briley honors Macon, and thanks everyone -- (21:55) Jones thanks Briley, and introduces Fiddlin' Sid Harkreader -- (22:17) Harkreader talks about meeting Macon in 1920, and playing with him for many years, even before WSM was a radio station -- (24:30) Harkreader reads a eulogy he wrote for Macon -- (26:22) Harkreader tells a funny story about Macon -- (27:41) Bully Of The Town (Fiddlin' Sid Harkreader) -- (30:49) Harkreader thanks the audience -- (31:00) Jones thanks Harkreader, and introduces Jo Walker -- (31:33) Walker thanks Jones, and acknowledges some WSM, CMA, and Opry members in the audience -- (33:05) Walker also thanks the other speakers for being there, and mentions the 45th anniversary of the GOO approaching -- (33:40) Jones thanks Walker, and introduces Harold Hitt -- (34:14) Hitt thanks all in attendance on behalf of the CMA and concludes the program -- [various crowd chatter for the remainder of the recording]
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Macon, Uncle Dave, 1870-1952; Country Music Hall of Fame & Museum (Nashville, Tenn.); Jones, Frank, 1928-2005; Minnie Pearl; Cannon, Sarah Ophelia, 1912-1996; Ford, Tennessee Ernie, 1919-1991; Acuff, Roy; Briley, Beverly, 1914-1980; Harkreader, Sidney J.; Walker-Meador, Jo;
